text: Loi Im Lan (born 6 February 1998) is a sprinter from Macau. She represented her country at one outdoor and two indoor World Championships. In addition, she holds Macanese records on several distances. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|2016 |World Indoor Championships |Portland, United States |39th (h) |60 m |7.83 |- |Asian Junior Championships |Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam |8th |100 m |12.17 |- |rowspan=3|2017 |Asian Championships |Bhubaneswar, India |21st (h) |100 m |13.27 |- |World Championships |London, United Kingdom |37th (h) |100 m |12.00 |- |Asian Indoor and Martial Arts Games |Ashgabat, Turkmenistan |13th (h) |60 m |7.72 |- |rowspan=3|2018 |World Indoor Championships |Birmingham, United Kingdom |42nd (h) |60 m |7.69 |- |rowspan=2|Asian Games |rowspan=2|Jakarta, Indonesia |17th (h) |100 m |11.96 |- |20th (h) |200 m |24.73 |- |rowspan=2|2019 |Universiade |Napoli, Italy |41st (h) |100 m |12.12 |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |43rd (h) |100 m |12.10 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *100 metres – 11.81 (+0.6 m/s, Hong Kong 2017) Macanese records *200 metres – 24.82 (+0.8 m/s, Macau 2017) NR Indoor *60 metres – 7.69 (Birmingham 2018) NR *200 metres – 24.47 (Macau 2017) NR *400 metres – 57.23 (Macau 2017) NR ==References== Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Macau sprinters Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Macau Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2018 Asian Games Category:Asian Games competitors for Macau Category:Competitors at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Loi Im Lan
